newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Tysan mulls spinoff of piling business.
newsitem.headline: Tysan mulls spinoff of piling business.

text.p: Tysan Holdings Ltd said on Tuesday it was considering the spinoff of its foundation piling and machinery hiring and trading business in Hong Kong.
"The board is considering the possibility of a separate listing of the group's foundation piling and machinery hiring and trading business on the Stock Exchange," Tysan said in a statement.
The company said a spinoff might "facilitate investors' assessment of the group's different business operations and broaden the group's capital base".
Tysan said preliminary enquiries had been made to various financial advisers but no one had yet been appointed.
No concrete plans for the potential listing had been reached and no application had been made to the stock exchange, it added.
Tysan engages in foundation piling, machinery hiring and trading, and property investment and development.
Trading in the company's shares resumed on Tuesday after a one-day suspension on Friday. The shares were down HK$0.22 at HK$1.93 in early trade.
